data.title: Treat emmet snippets as textmate
data.body:
Emmet snippets follow text mate syntax.
See https://docs.emmet.io/customization/snippets/#text-snippets
Therefore we should be able to use `CodeSnippet.fromTextmate` instead of `CodeSnippet.fromEmmet` and all the special code we have for emmet

The only catch is when in certain cases emmet returns multiple ${0}
${0} is meant to be the final cursor position and shouldn't occur more than once in a snippet.
This is clearly a bug in emmet. 

_Note_1:_ Emmet 2.0 doesn't have these issues. 

_Note_2:_ There are multiple cases where this happens. I was able to figure out root causes and fixes for a few of these cases, but decided its not worth chasing down these issues in emmet. Mainly because it is in maintenance mode and also, there might be more scenarios which we don't know. We can't fix what we don't know.

Till now, we went around this issue, by assigning [incremental values](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1.11.2/src/vs/editor/contrib/snippet/common/snippet.ts#L263) to such tabstops and [sorting](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1.11.2/src/vs/editor/contrib/snippet/common/snippet.ts#L231) them so that they appear before the numbered placeholder.

So in `<input type="${1:text}" class="${0}" id="${0}" style="${2}">`, the order of tabstops would be
- class
- id
- type
- style

which is not perfect, but this is the current behavior.

In this PR, we replace the multiple ${0} with tab stops starting from the max stop + 1

So `<input type="${1:text}" class="${0}" id="${0}" style="${2}">`
will be `<input type="${1:text}" class="${3}" id="${4}" style="${2}">`

Again, not perfect or ideal, but we don't lose any tabstops which is important.

With this, we can not only fix #19246 but also pave the way for simplifying the way we do snippets
(and remove legacy code, who doesn't like that? :) )

data.title: Vscode auto format spaces before and after curly brackets
data.body:
The auto formatting on vscode is great but in jsx if you do e.g.

Import {NamedExport} from 'blah' 

The auto formatter will do:

Import { NamedExport } from 'blah' 

Which is rather annoying. The applicable settings are all set to false so please don't suggest setting any of the usual suspects to false as per stackoverflow and Twitter.

It seems like an issue in vscode itself.

Please advise.

data.title: Error with JSX in VSCode. It doesn't know that JSX doesn't need React, but another provided function.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write some JSX without React but Preact/Inferno. In TypeScript. tsx. Use simple config for tsconfig.json with:

```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "jsx": "react",
    "jsxFactory": "h",
    "lib": [
      "dom",
      "es2015"
    ],
    "module": "commonjs",
    "target": "es6"
  }
}
```

2. You'll get error in VSCode (not TS compiler, exactly VSCode): 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4563032/25024453/b003849a-20a6-11e7-9cb7-f2d785beff0a.png)

With this error I'm getting all my .tsx files red.

data.title: Release notes (and .md files) don't zoom correctly
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: March 2017 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code.
2. Press Control+ 4 or more times so that the text is visibly, noticeably larger.
3. Click Help... Release notes OR open a .md file and click the "Open Preview to the side" button.

Expected results: Content is shown at the proper zoom while still filling the monitor, as long as there is enough content to do so. 

Actual results: Content is shown at the proper zoom but the lower right hand corner shrinks depending on the zoom level. 

Other thoughts: 
Note how the release notes content end before reaching the bottom of the screen. The "Welcome" screen doesn't have this issue and one difference is that it starts out centered vs. the release notes anchoring to the upper left hand corner. 

![incorrect_vscode_zoom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/238194/25023551/1dda580c-204f-11e7-9432-68fbbde0066b.png)

This is NOT new in 1.11, it's been there since I've used VSCode, some time prior to 1.0.

Confirmation: I searched existing issues and didn't see one just like this, apologies if it's there and I missed it, nobody likes duplicates.

data.title: [Insiders] Search viewlet click/dblclick behavior changed -- not in a good way

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (d1b315f03013b72d0fbb0a5c8ccc08088de315eb, 2017-04-13T06:05:22.216Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
---

FYI I have `"workbench.editor.revealIfOpen": true` set

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the search viewlet and search for something with results
2. Close all editors or make sure the editor that will open **isn't** already open
3. Click on a result -- 👍  it will open the file in a preview tab in the column of the active editor 

---
1. Open the search viewlet and search for something with results
2. Make sure the editor that will open **is** already open, but the active editor is in another column
3. Click on a result -- 🐛  it will switch to the opened editor tab, but won't focus it -- the original active editor will still be active and focused

---
1. Open the search viewlet and search for something with results
2. Close all editors or make sure the editor that will open **isn't** already open
3. Double click on a result -- 🐛  it will open the editor in a preview tab, next to the active one, but then will open another preview tab in the column to the right of the active one -- so you end up with 2 preview tabs for the file. This will keep going if you keep double-clicking until the 3 columns all have the file opened in them. And they are all preview tabs

A single click used to activate/focus the editor if it was already open or open a preview tab if not. While a double click used to both activate/focus and pin the editor if it was already open or open a pinned tab if not.

My guess is it has to do with the changes in this commit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/a079ef154c788f1f992377faddcb851e9e280b07

/cc @sandy081

data.title: Go to definition doesn't work for ES6 imports when omitting `index` from the path.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7
- Commit d1b315f03013b72d0fbb0a5c8ccc08088de315eb
- Date 2017-04-13T06:10:58.128Z
- Shell 1.6.6
- Renderer 56.0.2924.87
- Node 7.4.0

Steps to Reproduce:

**Code**

```javascript
import { member } from './myModule'
```

**Directory Structure**:  `./myModule/index.js`

1. Right click on `member`
2. Click "Go to definition"
3. The message, "No definition found for 'member'" appears.
4. Update code  to:
```javascript
import { member } from './myModule/index'
```
5. "Go to definition" now works as expected.

![gotodefinition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5246918/25022488/0c43582c-2064-11e7-9b0e-0d02eca7219b.gif)

I'm not sure if this is a vscode or a TypeScript specific issue (*my understanding is that the TypeScript engine is powering all JS intellisense*). Perhaps it can be resolved using some settings in `jsconfig.json`? Apologize if it's configuration based, but I couldn't find anything in the docs.

The docs on TypeScript's module resolution seem to suggest that this should work without having to explicitly mention the `index` file in the path: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/module-resolution.html

data.title: No squiggles appear at the end of a line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 or 1.12.0.
- OS Version: Any

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Cause an error squiggle to occur at the end of a line, i.e. the last column that has no character at that location (other than the new line). Repros with 0.11.0 cpptools extension with
`#ifdef

#endif`

Bug: No error squiggle appears (it appears in the Problems window). This doesn't repro with Visual Studio. We're going to work around this by moving the error location earlier, but we'd like to add the error to the end of the line.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1688 sounds related but different.

data.title: Electron: 1.6.2 update (<1.5) Completely breaks Dragon menu/submenu voice control (updated)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Development Environment:

OS: Windows 7 Professional SP1

Visual Studio 15 Community \ C++ Tools \ SDK
VS Code: 1.11.1 March release
VS Code: 1.12.0 Insiders March 12
VS Code: 1.12.0 March 7 master branch OSS build

Dragon Naturally Speaking DPI 14 (Voice/Dictation/Control)

Node: 6.10.1
NPM:  3.10.8

Description Of Bug:

Menu handling on Windows 7 started to behave differently
somewhere between March 7 and the Insiders March 12 update.

The problem is somewhat subtle since it may pertain
to voice control using Dragon. I believe for generic
software control in terms of menus, Dragon must utilize
the win32 API and messaging to detect the menus
and control them with voice commands.

Prior to the insiders March 12 (or close to that)
the stable VSC and insiders and OSS build March 7
both the top menu bar items as well as submenu items
were detected controllable by Dragon.

Now Dragon can detect and utilize the top level menus
but the submenus are now unable to be activated.
From of the feedback I can get from Dragon it appears
it detects the list of submenus but cannot control them.

I think this may also affect screen readers, but I do not
know for sure as I do not use one.

I am also thinking it probably has to do with the electron
framework/WindowsNativeInterface which I think has been updated or parts of it recently.

This is pretty big problem for accessibility and unfortunately
a big step back from prior operation.

I'm already working to contribute to the VSC so I can
probably help debugging this.  I can do successive builds
to try and figure out where the submenu started to fail after March 7
but having done this before it takes a long time especially by Voice
and maybe there's already an obvious place to start ?

Thanks

data.title: Doesn't work properly with git-lfs enabled repositories
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|markdown-toc|AlanWalk|1.5.1|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.1|
|format-php|Kasik96|1.1.2|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|vscode-wakatime|WakaTime|1.1.3|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|1.1.0|
|vscode-yaml-validation|djabraham|0.0.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.1|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|ansible|haaaad|0.2.5|
|phpcs|ikappas|0.7.0|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.9|
|Theme-MarkdownKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|
|ansible-autocomplete|timonwong|0.0.2|
|jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Commit to a git-lfs enabled repository
2. Attempt to push

```
This repository is configured for Git LFS but 'git-lfs' was not found on your path. If you no longer wish to use Git LFS, remove this hook by deleting .git/hooks/pre-push.

error: failed to push some refs to 'git@server:user/repo.git'
```

However, git-lfs is, in fact, installed and working fine from the CLI:

```bash
$ git push
Authorized uses only. All activity may be monitored and reported.Counting objects: 9, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (8/8), done.
Writing objects: 100% (9/9), 1.01 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 9 (delta 4), reused 0 (delta 0)
To server:user/repo.git
   0ba3fb8..3a055ec  master -> master
```

Note that this happens even when **not** pushing LFS objects.
